events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred on the morning of April 29th, involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection.
The claim has been categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and verifying the keywords related to vehicle collision.
An insurance agent has been assigned to this case to assist the customer throughout the claim process and provide necessary support.
The insurance company sent an acknowledgment of the received claim to the customer, confirming that the process has officially started.
The agent requested photos of the damaged vehicle, police reports, and witness statements to support the investigation of the accident.
The customer submitted all requested documents, including the police report and multiple images of the collision damage to the vehicle.
The investigation team began reviewing all evidence, including the submitted documents and external witness testimonies to ascertain liability.
After thorough review, the investigation concluded the accident was primarily caused by the other driver, with clear fault assigned.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer covering the estimated repair costs and any additional damages related to the accident.
The customer responded positively to the proposed settlement, expressing satisfaction with the proposed compensation and quick resolution.
Following the customer's acceptance, the claim was formally approved, allowing the payment process to commence immediately.
The payment covering vehicle repairs was issued directly to the customer’s bank account per the agreed settlement terms.
The claim file was officially closed after confirming payment receipt and customer’s final approval on case resolution.
All case documents and records were archived in the system for future reference and compliance with regulatory requirements.
